author: Victor

review: We have both the Amazon Fire TV and the Apple TV - they are used on the the same television (not at the same time as the cable has to be switched back and forth). We got this mainly to be able to watch Amazon Prime videos since Amazon won't license their app for the Apple TV. In general the setup and usability is fine, with the exception of its wireless feature. With the Fire TV, it is CONSTANTLY stopping to buffer while streaming and periodically pops up the screen about our bandwidth being too slow to properly stream. The Apple TV sits a foot away and it RARELY has streaming issues.As a recent example, the other night hubbie paid for a tv pilot from iTunes before checking availability from Amazon Prime. He watched it on the Apple TV, then thought I'd like it so offered to watch it again with me, this time he switched to the Amazon box as we might want to watch more episodes. The Amazon version was SD, and it balked and buffered so continuously during the first 10 minutes (and had the 'slow bandwidth disclaimer on the screen) we stopped, changed boxes and watched the iTunes HD version on the Apple TV - not a single stutter in the entire show!If your main reason for getting a box is to have access to Amazon Prime videos, then it's worth it, otherwise I'd consider the Apple or Roku (tho I haven't tried that one).
